snippet: Proposed changes would allow civilian government lawyers to represent defendants in military tribunals and open the door for some detainees to be moved to U.S.
abstract: Obama administration has sent proposal for changing rules governing military commission trials at Guantanamo Bay, intended to promote efficiency and reduce costs; changes include allowing judges to conduct some proceedings via videoconference as well as allowing civilian government lawyers to represent defendants.
